messages.title: Nationalists in “arm twisting” threat
messages.content: Labour candidate, Kenny Young, has highlighted the SNP's plan to force another referendum, showing that this will be a very close election.

messages.title: Only Labour’s Kenny Young can stop the Nationalists in Midlothian
messages.content: Labour's candidate, Kenny Young, has stressed the importance of stopping the SNP from using the UK Parliament as a base to push for a second Independence.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Scottish Labour have pledged that funding from the Mansion Tax on £2m houses will be used for an additional 1,000 nurses. This pledge means a UK Labour Government will deliver funding for more nurses over and above anything the SNP propose.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A fair deal for people at work
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour believes in a strong economy, where the benefits of wealth creation are felt by all. They aim to raise the minimum wage, promote the Living Wage and will also abolish exploitative zero-hours contracts as well as tackle the cost of living with a freeze on energy bills.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Labour and SNP 'neck and neck' in Midlothian with very close election.

issues.economy: Labour believes in a successful and strong economy.
issues.health: Scottish Labour pledges to sort out the chaos in NHS that the SNP have presided over.

housing.content: Funding from the Mansion Tax on £2m houses will be used for an additional 1,000 nurses.

leaflet.personalStatement: Kenny Young believes stopping the SNP from using the UK Parliament as a base to push for a second referendum on independence is crucial.

quotes.text: It wasn't a No vote. It was 'not yet.'
In Midlothian, only Labour can stop the SNP from using the UK Parliament as a base to push for a second referendum on Independence.

images.caption: Kenny Young is shown with a confident stance, presumably with intent to convey determination to fight for the constituency against the SNP's push for independence.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet is aimed at warning against the SNP's plans for another independence referendum and positioning Kenny Young as the alternative to the SNP in Midlothian.
